Tinggalkan Jakarta, Tokoh Oposisi Kamboja Mu Sochua Ditahan di Malaysia
07 Nov 2019, 12:44 by Indah Mutiara Kami
Kuala Lumpur - Tokoh oposisi Kamboja, Mu Sochua, sempat menggelar jumpa pers di Jakarta hingga pemerintah Kamboja meminta Indonesia melakukan penangkapan. Mu Sochua kemudian terbang ke Malaysia dan ditangkap di bandara.
Seperti dilansir Reuters, Kamis (7/11/2019), Mu Sochua ditahan di Kuala Lumpur International Airport. Mu Sochua adalah Wakil Presiden Partai Nasional Penyelamatan Kamboja (CNRP) yang telah dibubarkan pemerintah Kamboja. Pendiri partai oposisi itu, Sam Rainsy, juga ikut ditahan.
"Dia berada di holding room imigrasi di KLIA," kata salah satu pejabat komisi hak asasi manusia di Malaysia, Jerald Joseph.
Pada Rabu (6/11) kemarin, Joseph sempat berbicara dengan Sochua. Sochua mengaku diberi tahu bahwa tidak akan dideportasi ke Kamboja. Belum diketahui ke mana otoritas akan mengirimnya.
Departemen Imigrasi Malaysia belum merespons pertanyaan dari Reuters soal Sochua. Sementara itu di Kamboja, politikus senior Partai Nasional Penyelamatan Kamboja (CNRP)mengaku belum mengetahui penahanan Sochua di Malaysia.
Pekan lalu, Thailand menolak kedatangan Mu Sochua saat dia terbang ke bandara Bangkok. Dia lalu terbang ke Indonesia dan menggelar jumpa pers. Kedubes Kamboja di Jakarta lalu meminta pemerintah Indonesia menangkap Sochua.
Dalam jumpa pers di Jakarta, Sochua mengungkapkan rencananya untuk kembali ke Kamboja pada 9 November. Sejak awal, dia tahu akan diikuti hingga ke Malaysia.
"Dari sini, saya akan pergi ke Malaysia dan mereka akan mengikuti saya, mereka akan mengikuti kami ke mana saja," ungkap Sochua.

(imk/haf)

Leave Jakarta, Cambodia's opposition leader Mu Sochua Detained in Malaysia
Nov 7 2019, 12:44 by Indah Mutiara Kami
Kuala Lumpur - Cambodian opposition figure Mu Sochua held a press conference in Jakarta until the Cambodian government asked Indonesia to make an arrest. Mu Sochua then flew to Malaysia and was arrested at the airport.
As reported by Reuters on Thursday (11/07/2019), Mu Sochua was detained at Kuala Lumpur International Airport. Mu Sochua is the Vice President of the Cambodian National Rescue Party (CNRP) which has been dissolved by the Cambodian government. The founder of the opposition party, Sam Rainsy, was also arrested.
"He is in the immigration holding room in KLIA," said one official from the human rights commission in Malaysia, Jerald Joseph.
On Wednesday (6/11) yesterday, Joseph spoke to Sochua. Sochua claimed to have been told that he would not be deported to Cambodia. Not yet known where the authorities will send it.
The Malaysian Immigration Department has not responded to questions from Reuters about Sochua. Meanwhile in Cambodia, a senior politician from the Cambodian National Rescue Party (CNRP) claimed not to know about Sochua's detention in Malaysia.
Last week, Thailand refused Mu Sochua's arrival when he flew to Bangkok airport. He then flew to Indonesia and held a press conference. The Cambodian Embassy in Jakarta then asked the Indonesian government to arrest Sochua.
At a press conference in Jakarta, Sochua revealed his plans to return to Cambodia on November 9. From the beginning, he knew he would be followed as far as Malaysia.
"From here, I will go to Malaysia and they will follow me, they will follow us anywhere," said Sochua.

(imk / haf)
